title: Continuity in global economy, Asian production

content.question: Which of the following was an important continuity in the global economy from 1500 C.E. to 1700 C.E.?

choices.label: Muslim merchants controlled most major trade routes.
Asian societies produced most of the world’s manufactured goods.
Most goods were exchanged using overland trade routes.
Reliance on coerced labor systems declined.

content.answer: Asian societies produced most of the world’s manufactured goods.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
